availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Andrew Jackson Adkins (Pike Co, Ky, second lieut)

body.p: Pike County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of William Adkins and Nancy Adkins. Married to Francis Adkins. Farm laborer in Pike County in 1850. Farmer in Pike County in 1860. Served as first sergeant and second lieutenant in the 39th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) from November 18, 1862, to September 3, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pike County, p. 442B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pike County, District 1, p. 808.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0421.
